when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used as a general greeting during the daytime.
example: こんにちは、お元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, ogenki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to bid farewell for an extended period.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう！ (sayounara, mata aimashou!) - Goodbye, let's meet again!

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in formal settings.
example: ありがとうございます、先生！ (arigatou gozaimasu, sensei!) - Thank you, teacher!

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree.
example: はい、わかりました！ (hai, wakarimashita!) - Yes, I understand!

when_to_say: Used to decline or disagree.
example: いいえ、それは違います。 (iie, sore wa chigaimasu.) - No, that’s incorrect.

when_to_say: Used to politely request something.
example: これをください、お願いします。 (kore o kudasai, onegai shimasu.) - Please give me this.

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください。 (sumimasen, michi o oshiete kudasai.) - Excuse me, could you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the morning formally.
example: おはようございます、みなさん！ (ohayou gozaimasu, minasan!) - Good morning, everyone!

when_to_say: Used as a greeting during the evening.
example: こんばんは、お元気ですか？ (konbanwa, ogenki desu ka?) - Good evening, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to refer to drinking water or natural water sources.
example: 水を一杯ください。 (mizu o ippai kudasai.) - Please give me a glass of water.

when_to_say: Used to talk about consuming food.
example: 私はりんごを食べるのが好きです。 (watashi wa ringo o taberu no ga suki desu.) - I like eating apples.

when_to_say: Used when talking about going somewhere.
example: 学校に行くつもりです。 (gakkou ni iku tsumori desu.) - I plan to go to school.

when_to_say: Used to talk about watching or seeing something.
example: 映画を見るのが好きです。 (eiga o miru no ga suki desu.) - I like watching movies.

when_to_say: Used to refer to cats.
example: この猫はとてもかわいいです。 (kono neko wa totemo kawaii desu.) - This cat is very cute.

when_to_say: Used to refer to dogs.
example: 犬を散歩に連れて行きます。 (inu o sanpo ni tsurete ikimasu.) - I’m taking the dog for a walk.

when_to_say: Used to refer to edible items.
example: 日本の食べ物が好きです。 (nihon no tabemono ga suki desu.) - I like Japanese food.

when_to_say: Used when talking about drinking something.
example: コーヒーを飲むのが好きです。 (koohii o nomu no ga suki desu.) - I like drinking coffee.

when_to_say: Used to describe tasty food.
example: このケーキは美味しいです。 (kono keeki wa oishii desu.) - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or an early time.
example: 彼はとても早いです。 (kare wa totemo hayai desu.) - He is very fast.

when_to_say: Used to talk about educational institutions.
example: 私は学校に行きます。 (watashi wa gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used to address or talk about a teacher.
example: 先生に質問があります。 (sensei ni shitsumon ga arimasu.) - I have a question for the teacher.

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道に迷いました。 (sumimasen, michi ni mayoimashita.) - Excuse me, I got lost.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a companion or friend.
example: 私の友達は優しいです。 (watashi no tomodachi wa yasashii desu.) - My friend is kind.

when_to_say: Used to refer to one’s occupation or tasks.
example: 今日は仕事がたくさんあります。 (kyou wa shigoto ga takusan arimasu.) - I have a lot of work today.

when_to_say: Used to discuss or inquire about time.
example: 今、時間は何時ですか？ (ima, jikan wa nanji desu ka?) - What time is it now?

when_to_say: Used to describe a calm or silent environment.
example: この場所はとても静かです。 (kono basho wa totemo shizuka desu.) - This place is very quiet.

when_to_say: Used to refer to academic or self-study activities.
example: 私は日本語を勉強しています。 (watashi wa nihongo o benkyou shiteimasu.) - I am studying Japanese.

when_to_say: Used to describe something new or fresh.
example: 新しい靴を買いました。 (atarashii kutsu o kaimashita.) - I bought new shoes.

when_to_say: Used to describe an enjoyable experience.
example: このパーティーは楽しいです。 (kono paatii wa tanoshii desu.) - This party is fun.

when_to_say: Used to refer to books or written works.
example: 本を読むのが好きです。 (hon o yomu no ga suki desu.) - I like reading books.

when_to_say: Used to refer to streets, pathways, or directions.
example: この道をまっすぐ行ってください。 (kono michi o massugu itte kudasai.) - Please go straight on this road.

when_to_say: Used to address or refer to an instructor.
example: 先生はとても親切です。 (sensei wa totemo shinsetsu desu.) - The teacher is very kind.

when_to_say: Used when talking about the country Japan.
example: 日本は美しい国です。 (nihon wa utsukushii kuni desu.) - Japan is a beautiful country.

when_to_say: Used to describe the red color.
example: 赤い花が好きです。 (akai hana ga suki desu.) - I like red flowers.

when_to_say: Used to refer to vehicles or cars.
example: 車で学校に行きます。 (kuruma de gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I go to school by car.

when_to_say: Used to describe the blue color.
example: 青い空がきれいです。 (aoi sora ga kirei desu.) - The blue sky is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to refer to mountains or hilly terrains.
example: この山はとても高いです。 (kono yama wa totemo takai desu.) - This mountain is very tall.

when_to_say: Used to refer to oceans or seas.
example: 夏に海に行きたいです。 (natsu ni umi ni ikitai desu.) - I want to go to the sea in summer.

when_to_say: Used to refer to shops or establishments.
example: この店は安いです。 (kono mise wa yasui desu.) - This shop is cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe something aesthetically pleasing.
example: 日本の庭は美しいです。 (nihon no niwa wa utsukushii desu.) - Japanese gardens are beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to discuss or refer to the weather.
example: 今日の天気はどうですか？ (kyou no tenki wa dou desu ka?) - How is the weather today?

when_to_say: Used to describe doing something quickly or at an early time.
example: もっと早く来てください。 (motto hayaku kite kudasai.) - Please come earlier.

when_to_say: Used to describe an enjoyable situation.
example: 旅行はとても楽しいです。 (ryokou wa totemo tanoshii desu.) - The trip is very fun.

when_to_say: Used when talking about purchasing something.
example: 新しい服を買いました。 (atarashii fuku o kaimashita.) - I bought new clothes.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color white.
example: 白い猫がかわいいです。 (shiroi neko ga kawaii desu.) - The white cat is cute.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color black.
example: 黒いシャツを着ています。 (kuroi shatsu o kiteimasu.) - I am wearing a black shirt.

when_to_say: Used to talk about food items.
example: 食べ物は何が好きですか？ (tabemono wa nani ga suki desu ka?) - What food do you like?

when_to_say: Used to refer to drinks or beverages.
example: 飲み物はジュースが好きです。 (nomimono wa juusu ga suki desu.) - I like juice as a drink.

when_to_say: Used to talk about public parks or recreational spaces.
example: 週末に公園で遊びます。 (shuumatsu ni kouen de asobimasu.) - I play in the park on weekends.

when_to_say: Used when referring to airplanes or air travel.
example: 飛行機で東京に行きます。 (hikouki de toukyou ni ikimasu.) - I’m going to Tokyo by airplane.

when_to_say: Used to refer to train or subway stations.
example: 駅はどこですか？ (eki wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the station?

when_to_say: Used to describe snow or snowy weather.
example: 雪が降っています。 (yuki ga futteimasu.) - It is snowing.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the moon or a specific month.
example: 月がきれいです。 (tsuki ga kirei desu.) - The moon is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe rainy weather.
example: 今日は雨が降っています。 (kyou wa ame ga futteimasu.) - It is raining today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the sky or the heavens.
example: 青い空が見えます。 (aoi sora ga miemasu.) - I can see the blue sky.

when_to_say: Used to describe celestial stars.
example: 夜空の星が美しいです。 (yozora no hoshi ga utsukushii desu.) - The stars in the night sky are beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to refer to railway transportation.
example: 電車で通勤します。 (densha de tsuukin shimasu.) - I commute by train.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a room in a house or building.
example: この部屋は広いです。 (kono heya wa hiroi desu.) - This room is spacious.

when_to_say: Used to describe height or cost.
example: このビルは高いです。 (kono biru wa takai desu.) - This building is tall.

when_to_say: Used to describe something low in height or level.
example: この椅子は低いです。 (kono isu wa hikui desu.) - This chair is low.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that weighs a lot.
example: この箱は重いです。 (kono hako wa omoi desu.) - This box is heavy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is not heavy.
example: このバッグは軽いです。 (kono baggu wa karui desu.) - This bag is light.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or quickness.
example: 彼の車は速いです。 (kare no kuruma wa hayai desu.) - His car is fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe slowness or lateness.
example: 電車が遅いです。 (densha ga osoi desu.) - The train is slow.

when_to_say: Used to describe warm weather or objects.
example: このスープは温かいです。 (kono suupu wa atatakai desu.) - This soup is warm.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold objects or beverages.
example: 冷たい水をください。 (tsumetai mizu o kudasai.) - Please give me cold water.

when_to_say: Used to describe physical strength or durability.
example: 彼はとても強いです。 (kare wa totemo tsuyoi desu.) - He is very strong.

when_to_say: Used to describe weakness or fragility.
example: この紐は弱いです。 (kono himo wa yowai desu.) - This string is weak.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color blue.
example: 空は青いです。 (sora wa aoi desu.) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color red.
example: 赤い花が咲いています。 (akai hana ga saiteimasu.) - A red flower is blooming.

when_to_say: Used to describe the color yellow.
example: 黄色い鳥が飛んでいます。 (kiiroi tori ga tondeimasu.) - A yellow bird is flying.

when_to_say: Used to describe a calm or quiet environment.
example: 図書館は静かです。 (toshokan wa shizuka desu.) - The library is quiet.

when_to_say: Used to describe a busy schedule or situation.
example: 今週はとても忙しいです。 (konshuu wa totemo isogashii desu.) - This week is very busy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something easy or stress-free.
example: この仕事は楽です。 (kono shigoto wa raku desu.) - This job is easy.

when_to_say: Used to describe large or spacious areas.
example: この部屋は広いです。 (kono heya wa hiroi desu.) - This room is spacious.

when_to_say: Used to describe small or confined spaces.
example: この通りは狭いです。 (kono toori wa semai desu.) - This street is narrow.

when_to_say: Used to describe cleanliness or beauty.
example: きれいな花です。 (kirei na hana desu.) - It’s a beautiful flower.

when_to_say: Used to describe something messy or dirty.
example: 部屋が汚いです。 (heya ga kitanai desu.) - The room is dirty.

when_to_say: Used to describe tasty food or drinks.
example: このケーキはおいしいです。 (kono keeki wa oishii desu.) - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to describe bad-tasting food.
example: このスープはまずいです。 (kono suupu wa mazui desu.) - This soup tastes bad.

when_to_say: Used to describe something sweet in taste.
example: このお菓子は甘いです。 (kono okashi wa amai desu.) - This candy is sweet.

when_to_say: Used to describe spicy food.
example: このカレーは辛いです。 (kono karee wa karai desu.) - This curry is spicy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something sour in taste.
example: このレモンは酸っぱいです。 (kono remon wa suppai desu.) - This lemon is sour.

when_to_say: Used to describe something bitter in taste.
example: この薬は苦いです。 (kono kusuri wa nigai desu.) - This medicine is bitter.

when_to_say: Used to describe something pleasant or enjoyable.
example: 旅行はとても楽しいです。 (ryokou wa totemo tanoshii desu.) - The trip is very enjoyable.

when_to_say: Used to describe feelings of loneliness.
example: 一人だと寂しいです。 (hitori da to sabishii desu.) - It’s lonely to be alone.

when_to_say: Used to describe light or a cheerful personality.
example: 彼は明るい人です。 (kare wa akarui hito desu.) - He is a cheerful person.

when_to_say: Used to describe darkness or a sad mood.
example: この部屋は暗いです。 (kono heya wa kurai desu.) - This room is dark.

when_to_say: Used to describe objects that are old.
example: この本は古いです。 (kono hon wa furui desu.) - This book is old.

when_to_say: Used to describe something new.
example: 新しい車を買いました。 (atarashii kuruma o kaimashita.) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather.
example: 今日はとても暑いです。 (kyou wa totemo atsui desu.) - It’s very hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather.
example: 冬は寒いです。 (fuyu wa samui desu.) - Winter is cold.

when_to_say: Used to describe something close in proximity.
example: 駅は近いです。 (eki wa chikai desu.) - The station is near.

when_to_say: Used to describe something far away.
example: 学校は遠いです。 (gakkou wa tooi desu.) - The school is far.

when_to_say: Used to describe something simple or easy to do.
example: この問題は簡単です。 (kono mondai wa kantan desu.) - This question is easy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something challenging.
example: 日本語は難しいです。 (nihongo wa muzukashii desu.) - Japanese is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe slowness or being late.
example: 電車が遅いです。 (densha ga osoi desu.) - The train is slow.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or quickness.
example: 彼は速く走ります。 (kare wa hayaku hashirimasu.) - He runs fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe a kind person.
example: 彼女は優しいです。 (kanojo wa yasashii desu.) - She is kind.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather.
example: 今日はとても寒いです。 (kyou wa totemo samui desu.) - It’s very cold today.

when_to_say: Used to describe sunny or clear weather.
example: 今日は晴れです。 (kyou wa hare desu.) - It’s sunny today.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather.
example: 今日はとても暑いです。 (kyou wa totemo atsui desu.) - It’s very hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather.
example: 今日はとても寒いです。 (kyou wa totemo samui desu.) - It’s very cold today.

when_to_say: Used to describe high humidity.
example: 今日は湿度が高いです。 (kyou wa shitsudo ga takai desu.) - The humidity is high today.

when_to_say: Used to describe cloudy weather.
example: 今日は曇りです。 (kyou wa kumori desu.) - It’s cloudy today.

when_to_say: Used to describe windy conditions.
example: 今日は風が強いです。 (kyou wa kaze ga tsuyoi desu.) - It’s windy today.

when_to_say: Used to describe rain falling.
example: 明日雨が降るでしょう。 (ashita ame ga furu deshou.) - It will probably rain tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used to describe perfect clear weather.
example: 今日は快晴です。 (kyou wa kaisei desu.) - It’s a perfect sunny day.

when_to_say: Used to describe thunder.
example: 雷が鳴っています。 (kaminari ga natteimasu.) - There is thunder.

when_to_say: Used to describe a typhoon.
example: 台風が近づいています。 (taifuu ga chikadzuiteimasu.) - A typhoon is approaching.

when_to_say: Used to describe snow falling.
example: 今日は雪が降ります。 (kyou wa yuki ga furimasu.) - It will snow today.

when_to_say: Used to describe foggy conditions.
example: 今日は霧が出ています。 (kyou wa kiri ga deteimasu.) - It’s foggy today.

when_to_say: Used to describe humidity (general term).
example: この部屋は湿気があります。 (kono heya wa shikke ga arimasu.) - This room has humidity.

when_to_say: Used to describe mild or warm climates.
example: ここは温暖な気候です。 (koko wa ondan na kikou desu.) - This area has a mild climate.

when_to_say: Used to describe unstable or unpredictable weather.
example: 今日は不安定な天気です。 (kyou wa fuantei na tenki desu.) - The weather is unstable today.

when_to_say: Used when the weather clears up or becomes sunny.
example: 今日は晴れるでしょう。 (kyou wa hareru deshou.) - It will clear up today.

when_to_say: Used to describe snow.
example: 雪が降っています。 (yuki ga futteimasu.) - Snow is falling.

when_to_say: Used to warn about an approaching typhoon.
example: 台風が来る前に準備しましょう。 (taifuu ga kuru mae ni junbi shimashou.) - Let's prepare before the typhoon comes.

when_to_say: Used to describe perfectly clear or sunny weather.
example: 今日は晴天です。 (kyou wa seiten desu.) - It's clear and sunny today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the speed of the wind.
example: 風速が強いです。 (fuusoku ga tsuyoi desu.) - The wind speed is strong.

when_to_say: Used to describe a thunderstorm.
example: 雷雨が来ています。 (raiu ga kiteimasu.) - A thunderstorm is coming.

when_to_say: Used to describe a high temperature, usually in summer.
example: 今日は高温注意報が出ています。 (kyou wa kouon chuuihou ga deteimasu.) - A high temperature warning has been issued today.

when_to_say: Used to describe dry conditions, typically air or weather.
example: 今日は乾燥しています。 (kyou wa kansou shiteimasu.) - It is dry today.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot and humid weather.
example: 今日は蒸し暑いです。 (kyou wa mushi atsui desu.) - It’s hot and humid today.

when_to_say: Used to describe hail, the small ice pellets that fall during some storms.
example: 雹が降っています。 (hyou ga futteimasu.) - Hail is falling.

when_to_say: Used to describe air pressure, especially in weather forecasting.
example: 気圧が低いです。 (kiatsu ga hikui desu.) - The air pressure is low.

when_to_say: Used to describe the sound of thunder.
example: 雷鳴が聞こえます。 (raimei ga kikoemasu.) - I can hear the thunder.

when_to_say: Used to refer to heating systems or devices.
example: 寒いので暖房をつけてください。 (samui node danbou o tsukete kudasai.) - Please turn on the heater because it's cold.

when_to_say: Used to refer to air conditioning or cooling systems.
example: 暑いので冷房をつけています。 (atsui node reibou o tsuketeimasu.) - I have the air conditioner on because it’s hot.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a weather forecast.
example: 天気予報によると、明日は雨です。 (tenki yohou ni yoru to, ashita wa ame desu.) - According to the weather forecast, it will rain tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a thermometer.
example: 温度計が壊れています。 (ondokei ga kowareteimasu.) - The thermometer is broken.

when_to_say: Used to describe a prediction or forecast.
example: 天気予報は明日の予想を伝えています。 (tenki yohou wa ashita no yosou o tsutaeteimasu.) - The weather forecast is reporting tomorrow's prediction.

when_to_say: Used to talk about the likelihood of precipitation.
example: 降水確率は50%です。 (kousui kakuritsu wa gojuu paasento desu.) - The chance of rain is 50%.

when_to_say: Used to refer to clouds in the sky.
example: 今日は雲が多いです。 (kyou wa kumo ga ooi desu.) - There are many clouds today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to moisture or dampness in the air or on surfaces.
example: 湿気が多いので、洗濯物が乾きません。 (shikke ga ooi node, sentakumono ga kawakimasen.) - The moisture is high, so the laundry won't dry.

when_to_say: Used to describe heavy rainfall.
example: 大雨が降っています。 (oame ga futteimasu.) - Heavy rain is falling.

when_to_say: Used to describe the natural phenomenon of thunder.
example: 雷が鳴っています。 (kaminari ga natteimasu.) - Thunder is rumbling.

when_to_say: Used to describe a typhoon, especially one that is approaching.
example: 台風が近づいています。 (taifuu ga chikadzuiteimasu.) - A typhoon is approaching.

when_to_say: Used to describe fog or mist in the air.
example: 霧が濃いです。 (kiri ga koi desu.) - The fog is thick.

when_to_say: Used to describe global warming or the increase in Earth's temperature.
example: 温暖化が進んでいます。 (ondanka ga susundeimasu.) - Global warming is progressing.

when_to_say: Used to refer to Japan's official weather forecasting organization.
example: 気象庁の発表によると、明日は大雨です。 (kishouchou no happyou ni yoru to, ashita wa oame desu.) - According to the Japan Meteorological Agency's announcement, there will be heavy rain tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used to refer to ultraviolet rays, especially in the context of weather or sun exposure.
example: 紫外線が強いので、日焼け止めを使いましょう。 (shigaisen ga tsuyoi node, hiyakedome o tsukaimashou.) - The UV rays are strong, so let's use sunscreen.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the total amount of precipitation, such as rainfall.
example: 降水量が多い地域です。 (kousuiryou ga ooi chiiki desu.) - This area has a lot of precipitation.

when_to_say: Used to describe extreme weather conditions, either very hot or very cold.
example: 極端な天気が続いています。 (kyokutan na tenki ga tsudzuiteimasu.) - Extreme weather is continuing.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the difference in temperature, often between morning and evening.
example: 温度差が大きいですね。 (ondosa ga ookii desu ne.) - The temperature difference is large, isn't it?

when_to_say: Used to describe a period of excessively hot weather.
example: 今年の夏は熱波が続いています。 (kotoshi no natsu wa neppa ga tsudzuiteimasu.) - This summer, the heat wave continues.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the thunderbird, a type of bird associated with thunder in some cultures.
example: 雷鳥が山に住んでいます。 (raichou ga yama ni sundeimasu.) - The thunderbird lives in the mountains.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the thunderbird, a type of bird associated with thunder in some cultures.
example: 雷鳥が山に住んでいます。 (raichou ga yama ni sundeimasu.) - The thunderbird lives in the mountains.

when_to_say: Used to describe wind that is unusually strong.
example: 今日は強風が吹いています。 (kyou wa kyoufu ga fuiteimasu.) - The strong wind is blowing today.

when_to_say: Used to describe a snowstorm, especially with heavy snow and wind.
example: 吹雪の中を歩いています。 (fubuki no naka o aruiteimasu.) - I’m walking in a snowstorm.

when_to_say: Used to refer to regions with extremely dry climates.
example: 乾燥地帯には植物が少ないです。 (kansou chitai ni wa shokubutsu ga sukunai desu.) - There are few plants in the arid zones.

when_to_say: Used to describe intense rain over a small area in a short period of time.
example: 集中豪雨が降っている地域があります。 (shuuchuu gouu ga futteiru chiiki ga arimasu.) - There are areas where localized heavy rain is falling.

when_to_say: Used to describe significant long-term changes in weather patterns.
example: 気候変動が問題になっています。 (kikou hendou ga mondai ni natteimasu.) - Climate change is becoming a problem.

when_to_say: Used to describe a storm of dust and sand, often in desert areas.
example: 砂嵐が起きています。 (sunarashi ga okiteimasu.) - A sandstorm is happening.

when_to_say: Used to describe extremely cold weather, usually below freezing.
example: 極寒の地域に住んでいます。 (gokkan no chiiki ni sundeimasu.) - I live in an area of extreme cold.

when_to_say: Used to refer to frost, usually in the early morning after a cold night.
example: 霜が降りているので、車を温めてください。 (shimo ga oriteiru node, kuruma o atatamete kudasai.) - There’s frost, so please warm up the car.

when_to_say: Used to describe damage caused by floods.
example: 水害の影響で道路が通行止めになっています。 (suigai no eikyou de douro ga tsuukoudome ni natteimasu.) - The roads are closed due to flood damage.

when_to_say: Used to describe mild or moderate warmth, often referring to climates.
example: 温暖な気候が好きです。 (ondan na kikou ga suki desu.) - I like mild climates.

when_to_say: Used to refer to tropical climates or regions near the equator.
example: 熱帯地方は年中暑いです。 (nettai chihoo wa nenjuu atsui desu.) - Tropical regions are hot year-round.

when_to_say: Used to describe areas of low atmospheric pressure.
example: 低気圧が近づいています。 (teikiatsu ga chikadzuiteimasu.) - A low-pressure area is approaching.

when_to_say: Used to describe the area affected by or in the path of a typhoon.
example: 台風圏に入ってきました。 (taifuken ni haittekimashita.) - We’ve entered the typhoon zone.

when_to_say: Used to describe a sudden and intense period of cold weather.
example: 寒波が日本に到達しました。 (kanpa ga nihon ni toutatsushimashita.) - A cold wave has reached Japan.

when_to_say: Used to describe something vast, impressive, or magnificent.
example: 壮大な景色が広がっている。 (soudai na keshiki ga hirogatteiru.) - A magnificent view spreads out.

when_to_say: Used when referring to secret or deceitful plans intended to achieve a goal, often in a negative context.
example: 彼は陰謀を企てている。 (kare wa inbou o kudateteiru.) - He is plotting a conspiracy.

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is not stable or is subject to change.
example: 経済は不安定だ。 (keizai wa fuantei da.) - The economy is unstable.

when_to_say: Used when describing a response or effect that something causes.
example: その映画は大きな反響を呼んだ。 (sono eiga wa ookina hankyou o yonda.) - The movie caused a great reaction.

when_to_say: Used to describe something done quickly or with great speed.
example: 迅速に対応する。 (jinsoku ni taiou suru.) - To respond swiftly.

when_to_say: Used when something is at a very high or low point, often in a negative or surprising context.
example: 極端な意見が対立している。 (kyokutan na iken ga tairitsu shiteiru.) - Extreme opinions are in conflict.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone who is highly skilled or experienced in something.
example: 彼は熟練の職人だ。 (kare wa jukuren no shokunin da.) - He is a skilled craftsman.

when_to_say: Used when describing the act of breaking or overcoming a barrier or obstacle.
example: 困難を打破する。 (konnan o daha suru.) - To break through difficulties.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the process of combining or unifying different parts into a whole.
example: 二つの会社が統合した。 (futatsu no kaisha ga tougou shita.) - Two companies merged.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is skillfully designed or done in a clever manner.
example: 彼の巧妙な計画に感心した。 (kare no koumyou na keikaku ni kanshin shita.) - I was impressed by his clever plan.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is more than what is necessary or appropriate.
example: 過剰な期待はしない方がいい。 (kajo na kitai wa shinai hou ga ii.) - It’s better not to have excessive expectations.

when_to_say: Used when describing the act of overwhelming someone or something with force or superiority.
example: そのチームは敵を圧倒した。 (sono chiimu wa teki o attou shita.) - The team overwhelmed the enemy.

when_to_say: Used when describing something or someone as refined or of high moral standard.
example: 高尚な思想を持つ人だ。 (koushou na shisou o motsu hito da.) - He is a person with noble ideals.

when_to_say: Used to describe energetic, dynamic motion or lively activity.
example: その街は躍動している。 (sono machi wa yakudou shiteiru.) - The city is full of vitality.

when_to_say: Used when describing something that causes shame or humiliation.
example: 敗北は屈辱的だった。 (haiboku wa kutsujokuteki datta.) - The defeat was humiliating.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of exhausting energy or resources.
example: 体力の消耗が激しい。 (tairyoku no shoukou ga hageshii.) - The exhaustion of physical strength is severe.

when_to_say: Used when describing someone who is careful and avoids risks.
example: 慎重に決断を下す。 (shinchou ni ketsudan o kudasu.) - To make a careful decision.

when_to_say: Used when describing something or someone that is reliable and stable.
example: 堅実な投資が成功した。 (kenjitsu na toshi ga seikou shita.) - The reliable investment succeeded.

when_to_say: Used when describing something with many interconnected parts or aspects.
example: その問題は非常に複雑だ。 (sono mondai wa hijou ni fukuzatsu da.) - The problem is very complex.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an abstract idea or general notion.
example: この概念は理解しにくい。 (kono gainen wa rikai shinikui.) - This concept is hard to understand.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone who has sharp senses or keen perception.
example: 彼女は鋭敏な感覚を持っている。 (kanojo wa eibin na kankaku o motteiru.) - She has a keen sense.

when_to_say: Used when something is of great importance.
example: これは重要な問題です。 (kore wa juuyou na mondai desu.) - This is an important issue.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is weak or diluted.
example: その証拠は希薄だ。 (sono shouko wa kihaku da.) - The evidence is weak.
